verses.verse: Israel <S%H3478><s%> is a empty <S%H1238><s%> vine <S%H1612><s%>, he brings forth <S%H7737><s%> fruit <S%H6529><s%> unto himself <S%H7230><s%>: according to the multitude of his fruit <S%H6529><s%> he has increased <S%H7235><s%> the altars <S%H4196><s%>; according to the goodness <S%H2896><s%> of his land <S%H776><s%> they have made good <S%H2895><s%> images <S%H4676><s%>.

Their heart <S%H3820><s%> is divided <S%H2505><s%>; now shall they be found faulty <S%H816><s%>: he shall break down <S%H6202><s%> their altars <S%H4196><s%>, he shall plunder <S%H7703><s%> their images <S%H4676><s%>.
For now they shall say <S%H559><s%>, We have no king <S%H4428><s%>, because we feared <S%H3372><s%> not the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; what then should a king <S%H4428><s%> do to us <S%H6213><s%>?

They have spoken <S%H1696><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>, swearing <S%H422><s%> falsely <S%H7723><s%> in making <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%>: thus judgment <S%H4941><s%> springs up <S%H6524><s%> as hemlock <S%H7219><s%> in the furrows <S%H8525><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>.

The inhabitants <S%H7934><s%> of Samaria <S%H8111><s%> shall fear <S%H1481><s%> because of the calves <S%H5697><s%> of Beth <S%H1007><s%>–aven: for the people <S%H5971><s%> there shall mourn <S%H56><s%> over it <S%H3649><s%>, and the priests there that rejoiced <S%H1523><s%> on it <S%H3519><s%>, for the glory there <S%H1540><s%>, because it is departed from it.

It shall be also carried <S%H2986><s%> unto Assyria <S%H804><s%> for a present <S%H4503><s%> to king <S%H4428><s%> Jareb <S%H3377><s%>: Ephraim <S%H669><s%> shall receive <S%H3947><s%> shame <S%H1317><s%>, and Israel <S%H3478><s%> shall be ashamed <S%H954><s%> of his own counsel <S%H6098><s%>.
As for Samaria <S%H8111><s%>, her king <S%H4428><s%> is cut off <S%H1820><s%> as the foam <S%H7110><s%> upon <S%H6440><s%> the water <S%H4325><s%>.

The high places <S%H1116><s%> also of Aven <S%H206><s%>, the sin <S%H2403><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, shall be destroyed <S%H8045><s%>: the thorn <S%H6975><s%> and the thistle <S%H1863><s%> shall come up <S%H5927><s%> on their altars <S%H4196><s%>; and they shall say <S%H559><s%> to the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, Cover <S%H3680><s%> us <S%H1389><s%>; and to the hills, Fall on us <S%H5307><s%>.

O Israel <S%H3478><s%>, you have sinned <S%H2398><s%> from the days <S%H3117><s%> of Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>: there they stood <S%H5975><s%>: the battle <S%H4421><s%> in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%> against the sons <S%H1121><s%> of iniquity <S%H5932><s%> did not overtake them <S%H5381><s%>.

It is in my desire <S%H185><s%> that I should chastise <S%H3256><s%> them <S%H5971><s%>; and the people shall be gathered <S%H622><s%> against them <S%H631><s%>, when they shall bind themselves in their two <S%H8147><s%> furrows <S%H5869><s%>.

And Ephraim <S%H669><s%> is as a heifer <S%H5697><s%> that is taught <S%H3925><s%>, and loves <S%H157><s%> to tread out <S%H1758><s%> the corn <S%H5674><s%>; but I passed over upon her fair <S%H2898><s%> neck <S%H6677><s%>: I will make Ephraim <S%H669><s%> to ride <S%H7392><s%>; Judah <S%H3063><s%> shall plow <S%H2790><s%>, and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall break his clods <S%H7702><s%>.

Sow <S%H2232><s%> to yourselves in righteousness <S%H6666><s%>, reap <S%H7114><s%> in <S%H6310><s%> mercy <S%H2617><s%>; break up <S%H5214><s%> your fallow ground <S%H5215><s%>: for it is time <S%H6256><s%> to seek <S%H1875><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, until he come <S%H935><s%> and rain <S%H3384><s%> righteousness upon you <S%H6664><s%>.

You have plowed <S%H2790><s%> wickedness <S%H7562><s%>, you have reaped <S%H7114><s%> iniquity <S%H5766><s%>; you have eaten <S%H398><s%> the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of lies <S%H3585><s%>: because you did trust <S%H982><s%> in your way <S%H1870><s%>, in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your mighty men <S%H1368><s%>.

Therefore shall a tumult <S%H7588><s%> arise <S%H6965><s%> among your people <S%H5971><s%>, and all your fortresses <S%H4013><s%> shall be spoiled <S%H7703><s%>, as Shalman <S%H8020><s%> spoiled <S%H7701><s%> Beth <S%H1009><s%>–arbel in the day <S%H3117><s%> of battle <S%H4421><s%>: the mother <S%H517><s%> was dashed in pieces <S%H7376><s%> upon her sons <S%H1121><s%>.

So <S%H3602><s%> shall Beth <S%H1008><s%>–el do <S%H6213><s%> unto you because <S%H6440><s%> of your great <S%H7451><s%> wickedness <S%H7451><s%>: in a morning <S%H7837><s%> shall the king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> utterly <S%H1820><s%> be cut off <S%H1820><s%>.
